Structs/Extend.html#/s:7Service6ExtendV3.name: get(_:default:)
Structs/Extend.html#/s:7Service6ExtendV3.abstract: Gets a value from the Extend storage falling back to the default value if it does not exist

Structs/Extend.html#/s:7Service6ExtendV3.name: get(_:default:)
Structs/Extend.html#/s:7Service6ExtendV3.abstract: Gets a value from the Extend storage falling back to the default value if it does not exist

Structs/Extend.html#/s:7Service6ExtendVy.name: subscript(_:)
Structs/Extend.html#/s:7Service6ExtendVy.abstract: Allow subscripting by String key. This is a type-erased alternative to

Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.name: register(_:as:)
Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.abstract: Registers a pre-initialized instance of a Service conforming to a single interface to the Services.

Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.name: register(_:as:)
Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.abstract: Registers a pre-initialized instance of a Service to the Services.

Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.name: register(_:factory:)
Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.abstract: Registers a Service creating closure (service factory) conforming to a single interface to the Services.

Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.name: register(_:factory:)
Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.abstract: Registers a Service creating closure (service factory) to the Services.

Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.name: register(_:)
Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.abstract: Registers a ServiceType to the Services. This is the most concise register method since the ServiceType

Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.name: register(_:)
Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.abstract: Registers a Provider to the services. This will automatically register all of the Provider‘s available

Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.name: register(_:)
Structs/Services.html#/s:7Service8Servic.abstract: Registers any type conforming to ServiceFactory. This method should only be used when implementing custom

Structs/Environment.html#/s:7Service11En.name: production
Structs/Environment.html#/s:7Service11En.abstract: An environment for deploying your application to consumers.

Structs/Environment.html#/s:7Service11En.name: get(_:)
Structs/Environment.html#/s:7Service11En.abstract: Gets a key from the process environment

Structs/Environment.html#/s:7Service11En.name: isRelease
Structs/Environment.html#/s:7Service11En.abstract: true if this environment is meant for production use cases.

Structs/Config.html#/s:7Service6ConfigV6.name: prefer(_:for:)
Structs/Config.html#/s:7Service6ConfigV6.abstract: Use this method to disambiguate multiple available service implementations for a given interface.

Structs/Config.html#/s:7Service6ConfigV7.name: require(_:for:)
Structs/Config.html#/s:7Service6ConfigV7.abstract: Use this method to require a given implementation for an interface.

Structs/Config.html.name: Config
Structs/Config.html.abstract: The service Config is used to disambigute which concrete service should be used if multiple are

Structs/Environment.html.name: Environment
Structs/Environment.html.abstract: The environment the application is running in, i.e., production, dev, etc. All Container‘s will have

Structs/Services.html.name: Services
Structs/Services.html.abstract: The Services struct is used for registering and storing a Container‘s services.

Structs/Extend.html.name: Extend
Structs/Extend.html.abstract: A wrapper around a simple [String: Any] storage dictionary used to implement Extendable.

Protocols/ServiceType.html#/s:7Service0A.name: serviceSupports
Protocols/ServiceType.html#/s:7Service0A.abstract: An array of protocols (or types) that this service conforms to.

Protocols/ServiceType.html#/s:7Service0A.name: makeService(for:)
Protocols/ServiceType.html#/s:7Service0A.abstract: Creates a new instance of the service for the supplied Container.

Protocols/ServiceFactory.html#/s:7Servic.name: serviceType
Protocols/ServiceFactory.html#/s:7Servic.abstract: This service’s actual type. Used for looking up the service uniquely.

Protocols/ServiceFactory.html#/s:7Servic.name: serviceSupports
Protocols/ServiceFactory.html#/s:7Servic.abstract: An array of protocols (or interfaces) that this service supports.

Protocols/ServiceFactory.html#/s:7Servic.name: makeService(for:)
Protocols/ServiceFactory.html#/s:7Servic.abstract: Creates an instance of the service for the supplied Container.

Protocols/Provider.html#/s:7Service8Prov.name: register(_:)
Protocols/Provider.html#/s:7Service8Prov.abstract: Register all services you would like to provide the Container here.

Protocols/Provider.html#/s:7Service8Prov.name: willBoot(_:)
Protocols/Provider.html#/s:7Service8Prov.abstract: Called before the container has fully initialized.

Protocols/Provider.html#/s:7Service8Prov.name: didBoot(_:)
Protocols/Provider.html#/s:7Service8Prov.abstract: Called after the container has fully initialized and after willBoot(_:).

Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.name: config
Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.abstract: Service Config. Used to disambiguate and/or require concrete services for a given interface.

Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.name: environment
Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.abstract: Service Environment (e.g., production, dev). Use this to dynamically swap services based on environment.

Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.name: services
Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.abstract: Available services. This struct contains all of this Container‘s available service implementations.

Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.name: serviceCache
Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.abstract: This Container‘s cached service instances. This is not shared when creating sub-containers.

Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.name: make(_:)
Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.abstract: Creates a service for the supplied interface or type.

Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.name: subContainer(on:)
Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.abstract: Creates a SubContainer for this Container on the supplied Worker.

Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.name: providers
Protocols/Container.html#/s:7Service9Con.abstract: All Providers that have been registered to this Container‘s Services.

Protocols/Container.html.name: Container
Protocols/Container.html.abstract: Containers are used to create instances of services that your application needs in a configurable way.

Protocols/ContainerAlias.html.name: ContainerAlias
Protocols/ContainerAlias.html.abstract: An alias for another Container. All Container protocol requirements

Protocols/SubContainer.html.name: SubContainer
Protocols/SubContainer.html.abstract: SubContainers are Containers that have been created from a parent Container.

Protocols/Provider.html.name: Provider
Protocols/Provider.html.abstract: Providers allow third-party services to be easily integrated into a service Container.

Protocols.html#/s:7ServiceAAP.name: Service
Protocols.html#/s:7ServiceAAP.abstract: Empty protocol for declaring types that can be registered as a service.

Protocols/ServiceFactory.html.name: ServiceFactory
Protocols/ServiceFactory.html.abstract: Base protocol for all service factories. This is how the Services struct stores its registered services.

Protocols/ServiceType.html.name: ServiceType
Protocols/ServiceType.html.abstract: A Service type that is capable of statically conforming to ServiceFactory.

Protocols/Extendable.html.name: Extendable
Protocols/Extendable.html.abstract: Types conforming to Extendable can have stored properties added in extension by using the Extend struct.

Classes/ServiceCache.html.name: ServiceCache
Classes/ServiceCache.html.abstract: Caches services. All API besides creating a new ServiceCache are internal.
